column4: why is telepathy the official messenger in Ubuntu? It is crap still
yes
sorry about that
keep confusing the names
That only changed to the default quite recently from Pidgin.  Pidgin big :)
I think they made it official like two ubuntu releases ago

yeah since 9.10 if I remember correctly, also Ubuntu isn't the only distro where Empathy became the default,  I think most  Desktop Linux distros are doing Empathy by default now,  but Pidgin is still better for many people :)
sudo apt-get install pidgin
Empathy can do more, than just im, but  most of us  don't need those features, just im, so Pidgin :)
I already have it, just came to do a bit of harmless whining about empathy :)
maybe on the Gnome  IRC network
I based my whining is usage, you dummy ;P
right, and when I whine in here about features I don't like in Ubuntu based on useage of the distro for years,  I am probably still being off topic really :D
irc.gnome.org or something I think
no its okish,  I am just not that intrested in the Empathy vs Pidgin stuff
Pidgin is good, Epathy can be good,  and they don't both do the same stuff,  Empathy can do more
Pidgin is just a instant messaging and IRC program, Empathy can do more than that,  theres even a remote connect feature with Empathy
ohh, like vino/vinagre?
sure a bit like that, but maybe it uses its own thing instead of VNC
loasd of remote connect programs these days, even addon/s for Skype
